org.microbean.kubernetes.controller

Class AbstractEvent<T extends HasMetadata>

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.util.EventObject
      • org.microbean.kubernetes.controller.AbstractEvent<T>
  • Type Parameters:
    T - a type of Kubernetes resource
    All Implemented Interfaces:
    Serializable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    Event, SynchronizationEvent

    public abstract class AbstractEvent<T extends HasMetadata>
extends EventObject
    An abstract EventObject that represents another event that has occurred to a Kubernetes resource, usually as found in an EventCache implementation.
    Author:
    Laird Nelson
    See Also:
    EventCache, Serialized Form

    • Nested Class Summary

      The type of an AbstractEvent.

    • Method Detail

      • getType

        public final AbstractEvent.Type getType()
        Returns a AbstractEvent.Type representing the type of this AbstractEvent.

        This method never returns null.

        Returns:
        a non-null AbstractEvent.Type
        See Also:
        AbstractEvent.Type

      • getPriorResource

        public final T getPriorResource()
        Returns a HasMetadata representing the prior state of the Kubernetes resource this AbstractEvent primarily concerns.

        This method may return null, and often does.

        The prior state of a Kubernetes resource is often not known at AbstractEvent construction time so it is common for this method to return null.

        Returns:
        a HasMetadata representing the prior state of the Kubernetes resource this AbstractEvent primarily concerns, or null
        See Also:
        getResource()

      • getResource

        public final T getResource()
        Returns a HasMetadata representing the Kubernetes resource this AbstractEvent concerns.

        This method never returns null.

        Returns:
        a non-null Kubernetes resource

      • isFinalStateKnown

        public final boolean isFinalStateKnown()
        Returns true if this AbstractEvent's resource is an accurate representation of its last known state.

        This should only return true for some, but not all, deletion scenarios. Any other behavior should be considered to be an error.

        Returns:
        true if this AbstractEvent's resource is an accurate representation of its last known state; false otherwise

      • getKey

        public Object getKey()
        Returns a key that can be used to unambiguously identify this AbstractEvent's resource.

        This method may return null in exceptional cases, but normally does not.

        Overrides of this method must not return null except in exceptional cases.

        The default implementation of this method returns the return value of the HasMetadatas.getKey(HasMetadata) method.

        Returns:
        a key for this AbstractEvent, or null
        See Also:
        HasMetadatas.getKey(HasMetadata)

      • hashCode

        public int hashCode()
        Returns a hashcode for this AbstractEvent.
        Overrides:
        hashCode in class Object
        Returns:
        a hashcode for this AbstractEvent

      • equals

        public boolean equals(Object other)
        Returns true if the supplied Object is also an AbstractEvent and is equal in every respect to this one.
        Overrides:
        equals in class Object
        Parameters:
        other - the Object to test; may be null in which case false will be returned
        Returns:
        true if the supplied Object is also an AbstractEvent and is equal in every respect to this one; false otherwise

      • toString

        public String toString()
        Returns a String representation of this AbstractEvent.

        This method never returns null.

        Overrides of this method must not return null.

        Overrides:
        toString in class EventObject
        Returns:
        a non-null String representation of this AbstractEvent
